page.title: 14TYPICAL SCOTTISH FOOD
page.content: Scottish food includes stovies, haggis ,soup, butteries, brose, bannocks, porridge, scones and oatcakes.In Midmar Hall there is a Stovie Night where everyone eats stovies made of meat, onions and potatoes cooked in the meat dripping.On January the 25{th we have a "Burn's Supper" when we eat haggis, neeps and tatties.A haggis is made from a sheep's lungs and offal with lots of spices.The mixture is put into a sheeps stomach.Many people enjoy tattie soup for their lunch. In the mornings some people eat brose which is made from meal, hot water, a pinch of salt and spice and is rather like porridge.Oatcakes are also made from meal and so is skirlie which is made from meal, fat, onions, salt and potatoes.Mealie puddings are also made from meal with skins over them. These are boiled and eaten with mince.
